intro: Anil bungeana, commonly known as the white-flowered anil, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Anil bungeana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
